verses.verse: <S%H1984>Don't<s%> boast about <S%H4279>tomorrow;<s%> for you <S%H3045>don't<s%> know what a <S%H4279>day<s%> may bring <S%H3205>forth.<s%>
Let another <S%H2114>man<s%> <S%H1984>praise<s%> <S%H6310>you,<s%> and not your own mouth; a <S%H5237>stranger,<s%> and not your own <S%H8193>lips.<s%>
A <S%H68>stone<s%> is <S%H3514>heavy,<s%> and <S%H2344>sand<s%> is a <S%H5192>burden;<s%> but a <S%H191>fool<s%>'s <S%H3708>provocation<s%> is <S%H3515>heavier<s%> than <S%H8147>both.<s%>
<S%H2534>Wrath<s%> is <S%H395>cruel,<s%> and <S%H639>anger<s%> is <S%H7858>overwhelming;<s%> but who is able to <S%H5975>stand<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H7068>jealousy?<s%>
<S%H2896>Better<s%> is <S%H1540>open<s%> <S%H8433>rebuke<s%> than <S%H5641>hidden<s%> <S%H160>love.<s%>
<S%H539>Faithful<s%> are the <S%H6482>wounds<s%> of a <S%H157>friend;<s%> although the <S%H5390>kisses<s%> of an <S%H8130>enemy<s%> are <S%H6280>profuse.<s%>
A <S%H7649>full<s%> <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H947>loathes<s%> a <S%H5317>honeycomb;<s%> but to a <S%H7457>hungry<s%> <S%H5315>soul,<s%> every bitter <S%H4751>thing<s%> is <S%H4966>sweet.<s%>
As a <S%H6833>bird<s%> that <S%H5074>wanders<s%> from her <S%H7064>nest,<s%> so is a <S%H376>man<s%> who <S%H5074>wanders<s%> from his <S%H4725>home.<s%>
<S%H7004>Perfume<s%> and <S%H8081>incense<s%> bring <S%H8055>joy<s%> to the <S%H3820>heart;<s%> <S%H4986>so<s%> does <S%H5315>earnest<s%> <S%H6098>counsel<s%> from a <S%H7453>man<s%>'s friend.

<S%H5800>Don't<s%> forsake your <S%H7453>friend<s%> and your <S%H1>father<s%>'s <S%H7453>friend.<s%> <S%H935>Don't<s%> go to your <S%H251>brother<s%>'s <S%H1004>house<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of your <S%H343>disaster:<s%> <S%H2896>better<s%> is a <S%H7934>neighbor<s%> who is <S%H7138>near<s%> than a <S%H7350>distant<s%> <S%H251>brother.<s%>
Be <S%H2449>wise,<s%> my <S%H1121>son,<s%> and bring <S%H8055>joy<s%> to my <S%H3820>heart,<s%> then I can <S%H7725>answer<s%> my <S%H2778>tormentor.<s%>
A <S%H6175>prudent<s%> man <S%H7200>sees<s%> <S%H7451>danger<s%> and takes <S%H5641>refuge;<s%> but the <S%H6612>simple<s%> pass <S%H5674>on,<s%> and suffer for <S%H6064>it.<s%>
<S%H3947>Take<s%> his <S%H899>garment<s%> when he puts up <S%H6148>collateral<s%> for a <S%H2114>stranger.<s%> <S%H2254>Hold<s%> it for a wayward <S%H5237>woman!<s%>

He who <S%H1288>blesses<s%> his <S%H7453>neighbor<s%> with a <S%H1419>loud<s%> <S%H6963>voice<s%> <S%H7925>early<s%> in the <S%H7925>morning,<s%> it will be <S%H2803>taken<s%> as a curse by <S%H7045>him.<s%>
A <S%H2956>continual<s%> <S%H1812>dropping<s%> on a <S%H5464>rainy<s%> <S%H3117>day<s%> and a <S%H4079>contentious<s%> <S%H802>wife<s%> are <S%H7737>alike:<s%>
<S%H6845>restraining<s%> her is like <S%H6845>restraining<s%> the <S%H7307>wind,<s%> or like <S%H7121>grasping<s%> <S%H8081>oil<s%> in his right <S%H3225>hand.<s%>
<S%H1270>Iron<s%> <S%H2300>sharpens<s%> <S%H1270>iron;<s%> so a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H2300>sharpens<s%> his <S%H7453>friend<s%>'s <S%H6440>countenance.<s%>
Whoever <S%H5341>tends<s%> the fig <S%H8384>tree<s%> shall <S%H398>eat<s%> its <S%H6529>fruit.<s%> He who <S%H8104>looks<s%> after his <S%H113>master<s%> shall be <S%H3513>honored.<s%>
As <S%H4325>water<s%> reflects a <S%H6440>face,<s%> so a <S%H120>man<s%>'s <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H120>reflects<s%> the <S%H120>man.<s%>
<S%H7585>Sheol<s%> and <S%H11>Abaddon<s%> are <S%H3808>never<s%> <S%H7646>satisfied;<s%> and a <S%H120>man<s%>'s <S%H5869>eyes<s%> are never <S%H7646>satisfied.<s%>
The <S%H4715>crucible<s%> is for <S%H3701>silver,<s%> and the <S%H3564>furnace<s%> for <S%H2091>gold;<s%> but <S%H376>man<s%> is <S%H6310>refined<s%> by his <S%H4110>praise.<s%>

Though you <S%H3806>grind<s%> a <S%H191>fool<s%> in a <S%H4388>mortar<s%> <S%H8432>with<s%> a <S%H5940>pestle<s%> along with <S%H7383>grain,<s%> yet his <S%H200>foolishness<s%> will not be removed from <S%H5493>him.<s%>
<S%H3045>Know<s%> <S%H3045>well<s%> the <S%H6440>state<s%> of your <S%H6629>flocks,<s%> and <S%H3820>pay<s%> <S%H7896>attention<s%> to your <S%H5739>herds:<s%>
for <S%H2633>riches<s%> are not <S%H5769>forever,<s%> nor does even the <S%H5145>crown<s%> endure to <S%H1755>all<s%> <S%H1755>generations.<s%>
The <S%H2682>hay<s%> is <S%H2682>removed,<s%> and the new <S%H1877>growth<s%> <S%H7200>appears,<s%> the <S%H6212>grasses<s%> of the <S%H2022>hills<s%> are gathered <S%H622>in.<s%>
The <S%H3532>lambs<s%> are for your <S%H3830>clothing,<s%> and the <S%H6260>goats<s%> are the <S%H4242>price<s%> of a <S%H7704>field.<s%>

There will be <S%H1767>plenty<s%> of <S%H5795>goats<s%>' <S%H2461>milk<s%> for your <S%H3899>food,<s%> for your <S%H1004>family<s%>'s <S%H3899>food,<s%> and for the <S%H2416>nourishment<s%> of your servant <S%H5291>girls.<s%>
